content.user_title: Apply Anthropic Brand Guidelines to Your Content
content.value_statement: Maintaining consistent brand identity across documents and presentations can be time consuming and error prone. This skill provides instant access to Anthropic official brand colors, typography, and styling guidelines to ensure professional, on-brand visual content.
actual_capabilities: Provides Anthropic official color palette with exact hex codes for dark, light, and accent colors
Specifies typography standards with Poppins for headings and Lora for body text
Includes fallback font recommendations for cross-platform compatibility
Defines color usage guidelines for text, backgrounds, and accent elements
Offers smart font application rules based on text size and hierarchy
limitations: Does not automatically apply styles to existing documents, only provides guidelines
Requires manual implementation of colors and fonts in target applications
Font availability depends on system installation of Poppins and Lora
Limited to visual branding elements, does not cover voice, tone, or messaging guidelines

use_cases.title: Presentation Design
use_cases.description: Design teams can reference exact Anthropic brand colors and typography when creating PowerPoint or Keynote presentations for company meetings, conferences, or client pitches.

use_cases.title: Document Formatting
use_cases.description: Technical writers can apply consistent Anthropic branding to documentation, reports, and white papers by using the specified color palette and font combinations.

use_cases.title: Web Development
use_cases.description: Frontend developers can implement Anthropic brand colors in CSS stylesheets and ensure typography consistency across web applications and landing pages.

output_examples.input: What is the primary Anthropic dark color?
output_examples.output: The primary Anthropic dark color is #141413, used for primary text and dark backgrounds.

output_examples.input: Show me all Anthropic accent colors
What typography should I use for a branded document?
output_examples.output: Use Poppins font for headings (24pt and larger) with Arial as fallback, and Lora font for body text with Georgia as fallback. This ensures brand consistency while maintaining readability across all systems.

best_practices: Pre-install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment for optimal brand consistency and visual quality
Use the dark color (#141413) for primary text to ensure readability and maintain Anthropic brand identity
Apply accent colors (orange, blue, green) to non-text elements like shapes and graphics while cycling through them to maintain visual interest
anti_patterns: Avoid mixing Anthropic brand colors with other company color schemes as this dilutes brand identity
Do not substitute fonts with similar-looking alternatives, always use Poppins and Lora or the specified fallbacks
Avoid overusing accent colors on text elements, reserve them primarily for shapes and visual accents

faq.question: Do I need to install special fonts to use this skill?
faq.answer: The skill works with system fonts but recommends pre-installing Poppins and Lora fonts for best results. Arial and Georgia serve as automatic fallbacks if custom fonts are unavailable.

faq.question: Can this skill automatically apply branding to my existing documents?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides brand guidelines and specifications. You must manually apply the colors and typography to your documents using your design or editing software.

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill provides brand guidelines that can be applied to any document format including PowerPoint, Word, HTML, CSS, PDF, and other design tools that support custom colors and fonts.

faq.question: Are these official Anthropic brand colors?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill provides Anthropic official brand colors and typography specifications for creating on-brand visual content.

faq.question: How do I choose between the three accent colors?
faq.answer: Use orange as the primary accent, blue as secondary, and green as tertiary. Cycle through them for visual variety while maintaining brand consistency in multi-element designs.

faq.question: Can I use these brand guidelines for external client work?
faq.answer: These guidelines are intended for Anthropic branded materials. Consult your organization brand policy and usage rights before applying Anthropic branding to external or third-party content.
